page.title: 07THE COCKAYNE FAMILY
page.content: The emblem of the Cockayne family, the main landowners from Medieval times onward, is the cockerel. It can be seen on several of the graves including the stones in front of the altar, commemorating the last four Cockayne's to be buried in the church. Because of the 1806 Restoration however, there are no cockerels in any other part of the church. Previously there must have been since, when the West Window of the church was restored and it was discovered money could be saved by filling in a section hidden by the organ with old pieces of stained glass, one section shows several red cockerels. Other sections show odd pieces of arms and legs. It is interesting to see.
